name: Arithmetic Sequence General Term
statement: The nth term of an arithmetic sequence with first term a and common difference d is aₙ = a + (n−1)d.
philosophy: Defines a linear pattern across equally spaced terms.

name: Arithmetic Series Sum
statement: The sum of the first n terms of an arithmetic sequence is Sₙ = n/2 · (a + aₙ).
philosophy: Summing a linearly increasing sequence via pair matching.

name: Geometric Sequence General Term
statement: The nth term of a geometric sequence with first term a and common ratio r is aₙ = a · rⁿ⁻¹.
philosophy: Defines an exponential pattern across multiplicatively spaced terms.

name: Geometric Series Sum (Finite)
statement: The sum of the first n terms of a geometric sequence is Sₙ = a(1−rⁿ)/(1−r), for r ≠ 1.
philosophy: Uses cancellation to sum geometric growth patterns.

name: Geometric Series Sum (Infinite)
statement: The infinite geometric series converges to a/(1−r) for |r| < 1.
philosophy: Infinite growth is tamed when decay dominates multiplication.

name: Recursive Definition of Sequence
statement: A sequence can be defined recursively by specifying the initial term and recurrence relation.
philosophy: Defines each term in terms of previous ones; essential for recurrence solving.

name: Mathematical Induction
statement: To prove a property for all natural numbers, prove base case and inductive step.
philosophy: A fundamental principle for proving properties of sequences.
